questions.question: What type of business or product do you offer?
questions.subtext: Understanding your business model helps us recommend the right continuity approach

options.label: Physical Consumables
options.description: Products customers use up and need to reorder regularly

options.label: Service-Based Business
options.description: Ongoing services like marketing, cleaning, maintenance

questions.question: How do you currently charge customers?
questions.subtext: Your existing pricing model influences which continuity offer will work best

options.label: One-Time Purchases Only
options.description: Customers pay once and that's it

options.label: Retainer Contracts
options.description: Fixed monthly retainers for ongoing work

questions.question: What are your typical gross margins?
questions.subtext: Higher margins give you more flexibility with continuity offers. Margin = (Price - COGS) / Price Ã— 100%

options.label: Under 30%
options.description: Low margin, high cost of goods/delivery

questions.question: How often do customers naturally need your product/service again?
questions.subtext: Natural repurchase frequency indicates continuity potential

questions.question: Can you deliver NEW ongoing value each month (not just one-time education)?
questions.subtext: Continuity requires ongoing value, not just access to static content

options.label: Yes, Easily
options.description: Already have systems for ongoing value creation

options.label: Yes, With Effort
options.description: Can create ongoing value but need to build it

options.label: Maybe, Limited
options.description: Some ongoing value possible but limited

options.label: No, One-Time Value
options.description: Value is delivered once, no ongoing component

options.label: Need to Bundle Services
options.description: Would need to add support/services to create ongoing value

questions.question: How much does it cost you to onboard a new customer?
questions.subtext: Higher onboarding costs favor 'Waived Fee' continuity models

questions.question: What's your current customer retention/churn situation?
questions.subtext: Understanding retention helps us recommend the right incentive structure

options.label: High Retention, Low Churn
options.description: Customers stick around for a long time

options.label: Just Starting, No Data
options.description: Too new to have retention metrics

questions.question: What's your average transaction or project value?
questions.subtext: Transaction size influences which continuity model works best

questions.question: What's your PRIMARY goal with continuity/recurring revenue?
questions.subtext: Your goal determines the best continuity strategy

options.label: Predictable, Stable Revenue
options.description: Want to know revenue 30-90 days in advance

options.label: Increase Customer LTV
options.description: Maximize total revenue per customer over time

options.label: Reduce Customer Acquisition Cost
options.description: Get more value from existing customers

options.label: Increase Business Valuation
options.description: Build sellable asset with recurring revenue

options.label: Improve Cash Flow
options.description: Get more money upfront or regularly

questions.question: How ready are your customers to commit long-term?
questions.subtext: Customer psychology determines which incentive structure works best

options.label: Very Ready & Loyal
options.description: Customers love us and want to stay

options.label: Moderately Ready
options.description: Open to commitment with right offer

options.label: Prefer Flexibility
options.description: Want to cancel anytime without penalty

options.label: Price Sensitive
options.description: Main concern is getting best price
